availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Elihu Woodruff (Jefferson County, Kentucky, artist, lawyer, and colonel (U.S.A.))

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, artist, lawyer, and soldier. Louisville, Kentucky, native. Son of Elihu Woodruff and Susan L. White Woodruff. Married to Frances "Fanny" Clark Woodruff. Father of Ella S. Woodruff, Belle Woodruff, and Charles Lawrence Woodruff. Artist in Louisville in 1850. Household owned nine enslaved persons in Louisville in 1850. Attorney in Jefferson County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Louisville in 1860. Clerk of the Board of Alderman of Louisville in Jefferson County in 1861. Commissioned notary public in Jefferson County in 1861. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as colonel and major from June 28, 1861, to January 19, 1863. Captured at the Battle of Scary Creek in Virginia on July 17, 1861. Prisoner of war in Richmond, Virginia, from July 20, 1861, to September 10, 1861. Prisoner of war in Charleston, South Carolina. Prisoner of war in Columbia to April 5, 1862.
